metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17017 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Due to a missing case handling object types, a type confusion vulnerability could occur, resulting in a crash. We presume that with enough effort that it could be exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.4 and Firefox < 72.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17017` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '72.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.4.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
